data.question: What are the two methods described for the synthesis of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6]?
data.answer: Method A involves treating iron(II) formate with DMF and 88% formic acid and heating at 110 °C for three days. Method B involves partially dissolving [Fe3O(CH3COO)6(H2O)3] in DMF, adding 88% formic acid, and heating at 110 °C for four hours to overnight.

data.question: What is the role of DMF in the synthesis of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6]?
data.answer: DMF acts as a solvent in both Method A and Method B for the synthesis of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6].

data.question: How is the purity of the synthesized (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6] verified?
data.answer: The purity of the synthesized (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6] is verified through X-ray Powder Diffraction, as shown in Figure S-4 and Figure S-5.

data.question: What is the yield of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6] using Method B based on the iron(II) content of the starting material?
data.answer: The yield of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6] using Method B is 50% based on the iron(II) content of the starting material.

data.question: What technique is used to record the Mössbauer spectra of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6]?
data.answer: The Mössbauer spectra of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6] are recorded using a weak-field spectrometer in constant-acceleration mode in a transmission geometry.

data.question: What is the purpose of adding molten icosane to the sample for magnetic measurements?
data.answer: Molten icosane is added to embed the microcrystals, preventing them from moving under the application of a field and to isolate the sample from the atmosphere during magnetic measurements.

data.question: What is the significance of the observed intervalence charge-transfer (IVCT) band in the UV-Vis spectrum of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6]?
data.answer: The observed IVCT band in the UV-Vis spectrum indicates class II mixed-valence behavior in the Robin−Day classification scheme, which is significant for understanding the electronic properties of the material.

data.question: How does the synthesis method affect the yield of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6]?
data.answer: The synthesis method affects the yield of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6], with Method A resulting in an 83% yield and Method B resulting in a 50% yield based on the iron(II) content of the starting material.

data.question: Why is it necessary to mechanically separate the black and white crystals in Method A?
data.answer: It is necessary to mechanically separate the black and white crystals in Method A to isolate the desired product, (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6], from the mixture of products and unreacted starting material.

data.question: What does the presence of a broad IVCT band covering the whole visible spectrum suggest about the electronic structure of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6]?
data.answer: The presence of a broad IVCT band covering the whole visible spectrum suggests significant electronic interactions between the iron(II) and iron(III) centers, indicative of mixed-valence behavior.

data.question: Is the magnetic susceptibility data for (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6] indicative of spontaneous magnetization at low temperature?
Does the synthesis of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6] require the use of a high-pressure reactor?
Is DMF used as a catalyst in the synthesis of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6]?
Is the color change to dark-purple when powdered a characteristic of all mixed-valence iron formates?
Is the negative magnetization observed at low fields a common phenomenon in 3D molecular-based network magnets?
Are the black crystals of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6] soluble in water and DMF?
Does the synthesis of (Me2NH2)[FeIIFeIII(HCOO)6] involve the use of toxic heavy metals?
